documents.name: Protecting Controlled Unclassified Information in Nonfederal Systems and Organizations

elements.title: a
elements.text: Identify, report, and correct system flaws.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Install security-relevant software and firmware updates within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] of the release of the updates.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Implement malicious code protection mechanisms at system entry and exit points to detect and eradicate malicious code.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Update malicious code protection mechanisms as new releases are available in accordance with configuration management policies and procedures.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Configure malicious code protection mechanisms to:

Perform scans of the system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and real-time scans of files from external sources at endpoints or system entry and exit points as the files are downloaded, opened, or executed; and

elements.title: a
elements.text: Receive system security alerts, advisories, and directives from external organizations on an ongoing basis.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Generate and disseminate internal system security alerts, advisories, and directives, as necessary.
Block malicious code, quarantine malicious code, or take other mitigation actions in response to malicious code detection.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Monitor the system to detect:
Attacks and indicators of potential attacks and
Unauthorized connections.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic to detect unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Identify unauthorized use of the system.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Provide security literacy training to system users:
As part of initial training for new users and [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] thereafter,
Respond to findings from security assessments, monitoring, and audits.
On recognizing and reporting indicators of insider threat, social engineering, and social mining.
When required by system changes or following [Assignment: organization-defined events], and

elements.title: b
elements.text: Remediate system vulnerabilities within [Assignment: organization-defined response times].

Manage and retain CUI within the system and CUI output from the system in accordance with applicable laws, Executive Orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, guidelines, and operational requirements.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Update risk assessments [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Assess the risk (including supply chain risk) of unauthorized disclosure resulting from the processing, storage, or transmission of CUI.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Monitor and scan the system for vulnerabilities [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and when new vulnerabilities affecting the system are identified.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Update system vulnerabilities to be scanned [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and when new vulnerabilities are identified and reported.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Document activities associated with the transport of system media that contain CUI.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Restrict or prohibit the use of [Assignment: organization-defined types of system media].

elements.title: b
elements.text: Prohibit the use of removable system media without an identifiable owner.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Protect the confidentiality of backup information.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent the unauthorized disclosure of CUI at backup storage locations.
Implement multi-factor authentication for access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Uniquely identify and authenticate system users, and associate that unique identification with processes acting on behalf of those users.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Re-authenticate users when [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances or situations requiring re-authentication].
Uniquely identify and authenticate [Assignment: organization-defined devices or types of devices] before establishing a system connection.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Provide role-based security training to organizational personnel:
Before authorizing access to the system or CUI, before performing assigned duties, and [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] thereafter

elements.title: b
elements.text: Update security literacy training content [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

elements.title: b
elements.text: Update role-based training content [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].
When required by system changes or following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Protect and control system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Maintain accountability of system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas.
Mark system media that contain CUI to indicate distribution limitations, handling caveats, and applicable CUI markings.
Sanitize system media that contain CUI prior to disposal, release out of organizational control, or release for reuse.
Restrict access to CUI on system media to authorized personnel or roles.
Physically control and securely store system media that contain CUI.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Specify the following event types selected for logging within the system: [Assignment: organization-defined event types].

elements.title: b
elements.text: Review and update the event types selected for logging [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

elements.title: e
elements.text: Change or refresh authenticators [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] or when the following events occur: [Assignment: organization-defined events].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Include the following content in audit records:
What type of event occurred
Where the event occurred
When the event occurred

elements.title: f
elements.text: Protect authenticator content from unauthorized disclosure and modification.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Generate audit records for the selected event types and audit record content specified in 03.03.01 and 03.03.02.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Retain audit records for a time period consistent with the records retention policy.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Provide additional information for audit records as needed.
Identity of the individuals, subjects, objects, or entities associated with the event
Outcome of the event
Source of the event

elements.title: a
elements.text: Alert organizational personnel or roles within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] in the event of an audit logging process failure.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Take the following additional actions: [Assignment: organization-defined additional actions].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Verify the identity of the individual, group, role, service, or device receiving the authenticator as part of the initial authenticator distribution.
Obscure feedback of authentication information during the authentication process.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Change default authenticators at first use.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Establish and implement administrative procedures for initial authenticator distribution; for lost, compromised, or damaged authenticators; and for revoking authenticators.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Establish initial authenticator content for any authenticators issued by the organization.

elements.title: f
elements.text: Enforce the following composition and complexity rules for passwords: [Assignment: organization-defined composition and complexity rules].

elements.title: e
elements.text: Select a new password upon first use after account recovery.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Maintain a list of commonly-used, expected, or compromised passwords, and update the list [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and when organizational passwords are suspected to have been compromised.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Verify that passwords are not found on the list of commonly used, expected, or compromised passwords when users create or update passwords.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Store passwords in a cryptographically protected form.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Transmit passwords only over cryptographically protected channels.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Receive authorization from organizational personnel or roles to assign an individual, group, role, service, or device identifier.
Implement replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Prevent the reuse of identifiers for [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

elements.title: b
elements.text: Select and assign an identifier that identifies an individual, group, role, service, or device.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Manage individual identifiers by uniquely identifying each individual as [Assignment: organization-defined characteristic identifying individual status].

elements.title: c
elements.text: Prevent the removal of system maintenance equipment containing CUI by verifying that there is no CUI on the equipment, sanitizing or destroying the equipment, or retaining the equipment within the facility.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Approve, control, and monitor the use of system maintenance tools.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Check media with diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before it is used in the system.
Control physical access to system distribution and transmission lines within organizational facilities.

elements.title: e
elements.text: Control physical access to output devices to prevent unauthorized individuals from obtaining access to CUI.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Secure keys, combinations, and other physical access devices.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Escort visitors, and control visitor activity.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Review physical access logs [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and upon occurrence of [Assignment: organization-defined events or potential indications of events].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Determine alternate work sites allowed for use by employees.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Employ the following security requirements at alternate work sites: [Assignment: organization-defined security requirements].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Enforce physical access authorizations at entry and exit points to the facility where the system resides by:
Verifying individual physical access authorizations before granting access to the facility and

elements.title: b
elements.text: Maintain physical access audit logs for entry or exit points.
Controlling ingress and egress with physical access control systems, devices, or guards.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Authorize access to management of audit logging functionality to only a subset of privileged users or roles.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Develop, approve, and maintain a list of individuals with authorized access to the facility where the system resides.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Monitor physical access to the facility where the system resides to detect and respond to physical security incidents.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Review the facility access list [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

elements.title: d
elements.text: Remove individuals from the facility access list when access is no longer required.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Issue authorization credentials for facility access.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Record time stamps for audit records that meet [Assignment: organization-defined granularity of time measurement] and that use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), have a fixed local time offset from UTC, or include the local time offset as part of the time stamp.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Preserve the original content and time ordering of audit records.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Review and analyze system audit records [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] for indications and the potential impact of inappropriate or unusual activity.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Analyze and correlate audit records across different repositories to gain organization-wide situational awareness.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Report findings to organizational personnel or roles.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Implement an audit record reduction and report generation capability that supports audit record review, analysis, reporting requirements, and after-the-fact investigations of incidents.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Document interface characteristics, security requirements, and responsibilities for each system as part of the exchange agreements.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Review and update the exchange agreements [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Monitor and control communications at external managed interfaces to the system and key internal managed interfaces within the system.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Connect to external systems only through managed interfaces that consist of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security architecture.
Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.
Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent the unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission and while in storage.
Deny network communications traffic by default, and allow network communications traffic by exception.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Approve and manage the exchange of CUI between the system and other systems using [Selection (one or more): interconnection security agreements; information exchange security agreements; memoranda of understanding or agreement; service-level agreements; user agreements; non-disclosure agreements; other types of agreements].
Develop and implement a system-level continuous monitoring strategy that includes ongoing monitoring and security assessments.
Continuous monitoring activities.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Develop a plan of action and milestones for the system:
To document the planned remediation actions to correct weaknesses or deficiencies noted during security assessments and
To reduce or eliminate known system vulnerabilities.
Audits or reviews, and

elements.title: b
elements.text: Update the existing plan of action and milestones based on the findings from:
Security assessments,

elements.title: a
elements.text: Approve and monitor nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Implement multi-factor authentication and replay resistance in the establishment of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Terminate session and network connections when nonlocal maintenance is completed.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Establish a process for maintenance personnel authorization.
Assess the security requirements for the system and its environment of operation [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] to determine if the requirements have been satisfied.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Designate organizational personnel with required access authorizations and technical competence to supervise the maintenance activities of personnel who do not possess the required access authorizations.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Verify that non-escorted personnel who perform maintenance on the system possess the required access authorizations.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Maintain a list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel.
Implement the following types of cryptography to protect the confidentiality of CUI: [Assignment: organization-defined types of cryptography].

Establish and manage cryptographic keys in the system in accordance with the following key management requirements: [Assignment: organization-defined requirements for key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction].
Terminate the network connection associated with a communications session at the end of the session or after [Assignment: organization-defined time period] of inactivity.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Define acceptable mobile code and mobile code technologies.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices and applications with the following exceptions: [Assignment: organization-defined exceptions where remote activation is to be allowed].

elements.title: b
elements.text: Provide an explicit indication of use to users physically present at the devices.
Protect the authenticity of communications sessions.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Authorize, monitor, and control the use of mobile code.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Track and document system security incidents.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Report suspected incidents to the organizational incident response capability within [Assignment: organization-defined time period].
Implement an incident-handling capability that is consistent with the incident response plan and includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.
Test the effectiveness of the incident response capability [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

elements.title: d
elements.text: Provide an incident response support resource that offers advice and assistance to system users on handling and reporting incidents.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Report incident information to [Assignment: organization-defined authorities].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Develop an incident response plan that:
Provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability,
Describes the structure and organization of the incident response capability,

elements.title: a
elements.text: Provide incident response training to system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities:
Within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] of assuming an incident response role or responsibility or acquiring system access,
When required by system changes, and
[Assignment: organization-defined frequency] thereafter.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Review and update incident response training content [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and following [Assignment: organization-defined events].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Establish rules that describe the responsibilities and expected behavior for system usage and protecting CUI.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Provide rules to individuals who require access to the system.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Review and update the rules of behavior [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

elements.title: c
elements.text: Receive a documented acknowledgement from individuals indicating that they have read, understand, and agree to abide by the rules of behavior before authorizing access to CUI and the system.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Protect the system security plan from unauthorized disclosure.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Review and update the system security plan [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].
Includes other relevant information necessary for the protection of CUI.
Identifies individuals that fulfill system roles and responsibilities; and
Describes the safeguards in place or planned for meeting the security requirements;
Provides an overview of the security requirements for the system;
Describes the operational environment for the system and any dependencies on or connections to other systems or system components;
Describes specific threats to the system that are of concern to the organization;
Identifies the information types processed, stored, and transmitted by the system;

elements.title: a
elements.text: Define the types of system accounts allowed and prohibited.
Group and role membership, and

elements.title: b
elements.text: Create, enable, modify, disable, and remove system accounts in accordance with policy, procedures, prerequisites, and criteria.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Specify:
Authorized users of the system,
The accounts are no longer associated with a user or individual,
The accounts have been inactive for [Assignment: organization-defined time period],

elements.title: f
elements.text: Disable system accounts when:
The accounts have expired,

elements.title: e
elements.text: Monitor the use of system accounts.
Intended system usage.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Authorize access to the system based on:
A valid access authorization and
Access authorizations (i.e., privileges) for each account.

Apply the following systems security engineering principles to the development or modification of the system and system components: [Assignment: organization-defined systems security engineering principles].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Replace system components when support for the components is no longer available from the developer, vendor, or manufacturer.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Issue systems or system components with the following configurations to individuals traveling to high-risk locations: [Assignment: organization-defined system configurations].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Identify and document the location of CUI and the system components on which the information is processed and stored.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Apply the following security requirements to the systems or components when the individuals return from travel: [Assignment: organization-defined security requirements].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Develop, document, and disseminate to organizational personnel or roles the policies and procedures needed to satisfy the security requirements for the protection of CUI.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Require the providers of external system services used for the processing, storage, or transmission of CUI to comply with the following security requirements: [Assignment: organization-defined security requirements].

elements.title: b
elements.text: Provide options for risk mitigation or alternative sources for continued support for unsupported components that cannot be replaced.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Define and document user roles and responsibilities with regard to external system services, including shared responsibilities with external service providers.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Develop a system security plan that:
Defines the constituent system components;

elements.title: c
elements.text: Implement processes, methods, and techniques to monitor security requirement compliance by external service providers on an ongoing basis.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Review and update policies and procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Develop and document an inventory of system components.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Review and update the system component inventory [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

elements.title: c
elements.text: Update the system component inventory as part of installations, removals, and system updates.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Document changes to the system or system component location where CUI is processed and stored.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Identify software programs authorized to execute on the system.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Review and update the list of authorized software programs [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

elements.title: b
elements.text: Implement a deny-all, allow-by-exception policy for the execution of authorized software programs on the system.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Disable or remove functions, ports, protocols, connections, and services that are unnecessary or nonsecure.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Review the system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] to identify unnecessary or nonsecure functions, ports, protocols, connections, and services.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Configure the system to provide only mission-essential capabilities.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Prohibit or restrict use of the following functions, ports, protocols, connections, and services: [Assignment: organization-defined functions, ports, protocols, connections, and services].
Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to the system.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Verify that the security requirements for the system continue to be satisfied after the system changes have been implemented.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Analyze changes to the system to determine potential security impacts prior to change implementation.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Monitor and review activities associated with configuration-controlled changes to the system.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Define the types of changes to the system that are configuration-controlled.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Identify, document, and approve any deviations from established configuration settings.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Implement and document approved configuration-controlled changes to the system.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Review proposed configuration-controlled changes to the system, and approve or disapprove such changes with explicit consideration for security impacts.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Establish, document, and implement the following configuration settings for the system that reflect the most restrictive mode consistent with operational requirements: [Assignment: organization-defined configuration settings].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Develop and maintain under configuration control, a current baseline configuration of the system.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Review and update the baseline configuration of the system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] and when system components are installed or modified.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Protect the incident response plan from unauthorized disclosure.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Update the incident response plan to address system and organizational changes or problems encountered during plan implementation, execution, or testing.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Distribute copies of the incident response plan to designated incident response personnel (identified by name and/or by role) and organizational elements.
Designates responsibilities to organizational entities, personnel, or roles.
Addresses the sharing of incident information, and
Defines reportable incidents,
Provides a high-level approach for how the incident response capability fits into the overall organization,
Terminate a user session automatically after [Assignment: organization-defined conditions or trigger events requiring session disconnect].

elements.title: c
elements.text: Conceal, via the device lock, information previously visible on the display with a publicly viewable image.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for each type of allowable remote system access.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Authorize each type of remote system access prior to establishing such connections.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Prevent access to the system by [Selection (one or more): initiating a device lock after [Assignment: organization-defined time period] of inactivity; requiring the user to initiate a device lock before leaving the system unattended].
Display a system use notification message with privacy and security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules before granting access to the system.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Retain the device lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Enforce a limit of [Assignment: organization-defined number] consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during a [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

elements.title: b
elements.text: Log the execution of privileged functions.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Automatically [Selection (one or more): lock the account or node for an [Assignment: organization-defined time period]; lock the account or node until released by an administrator; delay next logon prompt; notify system administrator; take other action] when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Require that users (or roles) with privileged accounts use non-privileged accounts when accessing non-security functions or non-security information.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Restrict privileged accounts on the system to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]..

elements.title: a
elements.text: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

elements.title: g
elements.text: Notify account managers and designated personnel or roles within:
[Assignment: organization-defined time period] when accounts are no longer required.

elements.title: h
elements.text: Require that users log out of the system after [Assignment: organization-defined time period] of expected inactivity or when [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances].
[Assignment: organization-defined time period] when system usage or the need-to-know changes for an individual.
[Assignment: organization-defined time period] when users are terminated or transferred.
Significant risks associated with individuals are discovered.
The accounts are in violation of organizational policy, or

elements.title: d
elements.text: Reassign or remove privileges, as necessary.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Review the privileges assigned to roles or classes of users [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] to validate the need for such privileges.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Authorize access to [Assignment: organization-defined security functions] and [Assignment: organization-defined security-relevant information].
Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to CUI and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.
Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of CUI within the system and between connected systems.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Identify the duties of individuals requiring separation.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Define system access authorizations to support separation of duties.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Allow only authorized system access for users (or processes acting on behalf of users) that is necessary to accomplish assigned organizational tasks.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Train authorized individuals to ensure that publicly accessible information does not contain CUI.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Review the content on publicly accessible systems for CUI and remove such information, if discovered.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Develop a plan for managing supply chain risks associated with the research and development, design, manufacturing, acquisition, delivery, integration, operations, maintenance, and disposal of the system, system components, or system services.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Review and update the supply chain risk management plan [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

elements.title: c
elements.text: Protect the supply chain risk management plan from unauthorized disclosure.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to the system.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Establish a process for identifying and addressing weaknesses or deficiencies in the supply chain elements and processes.
Develop and implement acquisition strategies, contract tools, and procurement methods to identify, protect against, and mitigate supply chain risks.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Enforce the following security requirements to protect against supply chain risks to the system, system components, or system services and to limit the harm or consequences from supply chain-related events: [Assignment: organization-defined security requirements].

elements.title: a
elements.text: When individual employment is terminated:
Disable system access within [Assignment: organization-defined time period],
Terminate or revoke authenticators and credentials associated with the individual, and

elements.title: b
elements.text: Rescreen individuals in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined conditions requiring rescreening].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for mobile devices.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Implement full-device or container-based encryption to protect the confidentiality of CUI on mobile devices.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Authorize the connection of mobile devices to the system.

elements.title: a
elements.text: Prohibit the use of external systems unless the systems are specifically authorized.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Restrict the use of organization-controlled portable storage devices by authorized individuals on external systems.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Permit authorized individuals to use external systems to access the organizational system or to process, store, or transmit CUI only after:
Verifying that the security requirements on the external systems as specified in the organization’s system security plans have been satisfied and
Retaining approved system connection or processing agreements with the organizational entities hosting the external systems.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Establish the following security requirements to be satisfied on external systems prior to allowing use of or access to those systems by authorized individuals: [Assignment: organization-defined security requirements].

elements.title: a
elements.text: Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for each type of wireless access to the system.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Authorize the remote execution of privileged commands and remote access to security-relevant information.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Route remote access to the system through authorized and managed access control points.

elements.title: d
elements.text: Protect wireless access to the system using authentication and encryption.

elements.title: c
elements.text: Disable, when not intended for use, wireless networking capabilities prior to issuance and deployment.

elements.title: b
elements.text: Authorize each type of wireless access to the system prior to establishing such connections.
Modify access authorization to correspond with any changes in operational need.

elements.title: b
elements.text: When individuals are reassigned or transferred to other positions in the organization:
Review and confirm the ongoing operational need for current logical and physical access authorizations to the system and facility, and
Retrieve security-related system property.
